name: @n8n/n8n-nodes-langchain.lmChatAzureOpenAi
description: For advanced usage with an AI chain

properties.displayName: This node must be connected to an AI chain. Insert one
properties.name: notice

properties.displayName: If using JSON response format, you must include word "json" in the prompt in your chain or agent. Also, make sure to select latest models released post November 2023.
properties.name: notice
model
properties.description: The name of the model(deployment) to use (e.g., gpt-4, gpt-35-turbo)

properties.name: options
properties.description: Additional options to add

options.name: frequencyPenalty
options.description: Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim

options.name: maxTokens
options.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion. Most models have a context length of 2048 tokens (except for the newest models, which support 32,768). Use -1 for default.

options.name: Text
options.description: Regular text response

options.name: JSON
options.description: Enables JSON mode, which should guarantee the message the model generates is valid JSON

options.name: presencePenalty
options.description: Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics

options.name: temperature
options.description: Controls randomness: Lowering results in less random completions. As the temperature approaches zero, the model will become deterministic and repetitive.

options.name: timeout
options.description: Maximum amount of time a request is allowed to take in milliseconds

options.name: maxRetries
options.description: Maximum number of retries to attempt on failure

options.name: topP
options.description: Controls diversity via nucleus sampling: 0.5 means half of all likelihood-weighted options are considered. We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

description: A simple chain to prompt a large language model

properties.displayName: Save time with an example of how this node works
properties.name: notice

options.name: Connected Chat Trigger Node
options.description: Looks for an input field called 'chatInput' that is coming from a directly connected Chat Trigger

options.name: Define below
options.description: Use an expression to reference data in previous nodes or enter static text

properties.name: text
properties.placeholder: e.g. Hello, how can you help me?

properties.displayName: Chat Messages (if Using a Chat Model)
properties.name: messages

options.name: Text
options.description: Simple text message

options.name: Image (Binary)
options.description: Process the binary input from the previous node

options.name: Image (URL)
options.description: Process the image from the specified URL

values.name: binaryImageDataKey
values.description: The name of the field in the chain's input that contains the binary image file to be processed

values.name: imageUrl
values.description: URL to the image to be processed
Control how the model processes the image and generates its textual understanding
values.name: imageDetail

options.name: Auto
options.description: Model will use the auto setting which will look at the image input size and decide if it should use the low or high setting

options.name: Low
options.description: The model will receive a low-res 512px x 512px version of the image, and represent the image with a budget of 65 tokens. This allows the API to return faster responses and consume fewer input tokens for use cases that do not require high detail.

options.name: High
options.description: Allows the model to see the low res image and then creates detailed crops of input images as 512px squares based on the input image size. Each of the detailed crops uses twice the token budget (65 tokens) for a total of 129 tokens.

properties.name: batching
properties.description: Batch processing options for rate limiting

options.name: batchSize
options.description: How many items to process in parallel. This is useful for rate limiting, but might impact the log output ordering.

options.name: delayBetweenBatches
options.description: Delay in milliseconds between batches. This is useful for rate limiting.

properties.displayName: Connect an output parser on the canvas to specify the output format you require
properties.name: notice

properties.displayName: Connect an additional language model on the canvas to use it as a fallback if the main model fails
properties.name: fallbackNotice
